intro: Callistachys staurophylla, commonly known as the starfruit hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hard seeds. Callistachys staurophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
